overview:
Charlie Crystle is a serial founder/CEO software startups, including ChiliSoft ( $70 million exit to Cobalt Networks/Sun in 2000), Mission Research (10,000 nonprofit customers), and now Jawaya.

OTHER HISTORY –Board member at Alliance for Sustainability –formerly on Board of YMCA Lancaster and helped orchestrate its turnaround –advocated for children’s rights in Central America, working with rights groups like Carter Center, GHRC, others –served on the Millersville University Software Productization board –serve on school board –advised and invested in ZapSpot (founded by Victor Cho, CEO of KodakGallery.com, and Dan Frumin, formerly of Microsoft) –board/investor for Mercury2 (led by Christine Herron, First Round Capital/Intel Capital). –started the Lancaster BikeWorks community bikes program
